page.title: 06ANCIENT MONUMENTS
page.content: These underground chambers are named after the cornish word {FOGO }meaning cave.They are only found west of the Fal estuary.Halligye Fogou is very well preserved,and dates from the iron age.The main underground chamber is 10 metres long and 2.65m high.At the end a narrow entrance of granite is only 70cm high and 45cm wide.Leading off the main chamber are narrow passage ways called {CREEPS}.The creep leading off left is 18m long,80cm high and 50cm wide.The reason for their consruction is yet unknown.Burial chambers? Underground storage for meat and dairy produce? Place of worship? Secret hiding places? Their consruction is of granite stones,farming the walls with slabs of granite farming the roof.A place of great antiquity and mystery.
